column1: For a moment Vashti felt lonely. Then she generated the light
column2: and the sight of her room
column3: flooded with radiance and studded with electric buttons
column4: revived her. There were buttons and switches everywhere — buttons to call for food
column6: for clothing. There was the hot-bath button
column7: by pressure of which a basin of (imitation) marble rose out of the floor
column8: filled to the brim with a warm deodorized liquid. There was the cold-bath button. There was the button that produced literature
column9: and there were of course the buttons by which she communicated with her friends. The room
column11: was in touch with all that she cared for in the world. Vashti's next move was to turn off the isolation switch
column12: and all the accumulations of the last three minutes burst upon her. The room was filled with the noise of bells
column13: and speaking-tubes. What was the new food like? Could she recommend it? Has she had any ideas lately? Might one tell her one's own ideas? Would she make an engagement to visit the public nurseries at an early date — say this day month?
